content: Fantastic!
Great game great story. First game in the series where i feel likeni knie where to go next. cloud saves dont work worth a damn though. Lost 5 hours worth of gameplay.
Don't like the portrait mode idea, it would be better if I could choose the mode
Great story I'm hanging in there with the controls though.
Story was pretty good. Going yo play 11 next
Not bad for mobile games, but don't like the movement somehow its hard to move compared to other games with similar control.

THE GOOD: A neat game with simple rpg mechanics and an ok story. You can recruit some of the monsters you fight and the pixel art is pretty nice looking. A playthrough can take over 30 hours to complete. High replayability. THE BAD: Leveling up can be pretty grindy. Only a minority of monsters in the game are recruitable. Of the monsters that are recruitable, many are only recruitable late game. Wonky analogue. Inventory menus are a pain.
It's just not a good game.
Game is top notch stuff. Easilly 30 hours of classic rpg content. A gem among the rubish that is mobile gaming.
This is excellent. Very easy to control.
Great port.
Best dq
Put about 45 hours into the game. Great port well worth the money.
long live dragon quest
One of the best games ever made and looks amazing in HD.
10/10 would marry nera again
Can't sync data with cloud on S9 now that Google Drive is the storage location rather than Samsung Cloud, please fix!

2.5D projection view makes it so many entrances and staircases are hidden unless you rotate your camera angle. I last played a Dragon Quest in 1994 when my brother got Dragon Warrior 4. I still think that's the best game ever, but I hear DQ5 is better. We'll see.

Very poor port. They made no attempt to upgrade the very low res graphics. The game will ONLY play in PORTRAIT mode, ignoring that most mobile games are played in LANDSCAPE. Poor options to save.
The BEST dragon quest game! The story is amazing and the monster taming stuff is fun to! Evreything about this game is amazing.
A good game.

A great game at a reasonable price with all the DS copies going for scalper prices. The touch controls are annoying if you are more a console gamer than mobile, but it's definitely worth getting if you're a fan of RPGs or Dragon Quest. I only played on a tablet so I'm not sure how this would be on a smaller phone screen.

Probably one of the best in the series but what's up with the cloud saves? When I try to do cloud saves it lets me select my profile and give permissions but then all it does is go to a black screen with a blue loading circle in the top left corner of the screen. Please fix this

Simply amazing! Although it is arguably one of the easiest DQ games, it has a fantastic, generational story and that traditional DQ feeling that never gets boring. Fun combat, cool characters and overall a great JRPG experience.
It's aight
Good port of a classic
Excellent game. No issues. Used it on 4 month camping trip. Never froze up once.

It was a quality port with no issues. Cloud save was available and the game was more smooth than any other experience I've had with this game. Touch screen controls are very intuitive and convenient for this game series in particular.
Much has been said about DQ5 itself and I don't need to repeat that here. This is another great mobile port, just like DQ4 - expect the same menus and controls.
I love this game You get to be a baby, and then a kid, then you save the world, you grow up, make monster friends, have kids, and then you fight as those kids
Not nearly as good as DQ6 but then again, none of them are. DQ6 is in a league of it's own and is the best RPG ever made. This one is really good though.
Like bro this game is the best one in the whole series
I honestly think this is one of the best pixel dragon quest game. But i would give it a 5/5 if the controls would work for a ps4 controller and if it had a ds controls.

The Ultimate RPG in the Zenithian Trilogy. Music is stellar, the controls are the exact same as the other games, it is no wonder this game is highly regarded as the best game in this saga for reasons. The story sucks you in, the timeless monster recruitment mechanics that keep you engaged, and a bonus, you can "Appraise" items with the Peep spell. Fixes that issue from Dragon Quest 4 with Torneko. Highly recommend if you are stuck at home.

Really great port! Just finished the game with around 41 hours and had a blast with it. Really recommend this for any old and new DQ fan.
Controls are decent and story is good but too much grinding in my opinion.
Great
I lost my cloud save!!
There is a problem where it stutters, losing frames that makes go slower. It is not smooth.

I am really enjoying this game so far. The controls are easy to understand and can conveniently be played with one hand. Some on here do not like the vertical screen but this game is easy to play on a subway or other tight quarters. Good story so far. It reminds me of cross between zelda link to the past and final fantasy. I highly recommend this game!
Great game, well worth the money
Overall great game, however the translation seems to get REALLY bad when the first Ladja/Kon/Slon fight comes along. What's with that?
Amazing game and app worked perfectly. Highly recommend!
Always wanted to play this and loved this game when I did. Helped me through a month of quarantine from covid 19.

Dragon Quest V is how I'm spending much of my time sheltered-in-place because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Bought this game because it's one of the highest-rated in the series and rightly so. Played the firstüêâ Warrior on the NES back in the 90's and I'm getting back into genre. The price is worth it for the better graphics and music over the decent DQ imitation Dragon Lapis. Playing on the Android is also more convenient then using an online emulator and this game's developers deserve the $upport.

Classic and beloved jrpg reimagined for mobile technology. The price is off-putting but the adventure is well worth the cost. Graphics are of the highest quality pixel art. Battle animations are smooth and fluid. The story is the real star of the show here. The ups and downs had me nearly in tears and grinning ear to ear. No crashes or technical issues found in my playthrough of 53 hours. I am 100% satisfied with this purchase.
An awesome piece of my childhood that is now mine again. Great gameplay and awesome story. I can't recommend it enough.
Love it!

So far,I really love Dragon Quest V but I have an issue with this version. I believe the update back in the summer of last year made the game run worse. Everytime I boot up the game, it has slow down in battles and the world map. It's annoying and I was hoping the recent update would fix that, but it didn't. It could be my phone, but DQ IV and VI run perfectly on my phone so there is no excuse. Please fix this issue.
Wonderful story all the way through! Felt different from the others but like the others still a fantastic game
Game works now compared to my previous review.

Fun. But I'm having issues. If I open another app. I loose my progress. How can I prevent this from happening? I contacted the developer for a refund and they never responded. Asking my bank for a charge back.
Best single player jrpg on mobile!
Game won't save and I have reported it and all and no one will get back to me at all it has been 3 weeks now and still nothing I want my money refunded
I love it
Such an amazing game it's Defo a must play if you love Dragon quest. It's my favourite out of the zenithian trilogy.
Dragon Quest your story made me play this game again

I've barely started and I'm looking forward to playing, but I'm giving this game 1 star until the developers figure out a way to enable cloud save without needing access to my entire Google drive. What the hell is that about?
One of the greatest classic games you can play
Great

5 has got to be my favorite of the Legendary Zenithian Hero trilogy. Not only is it vastly more fun than 4; 6 went way too heavy on the whole Dream world being the real world thing. It got really confusing for me at times. In fact the simple fact that King Somnus returned to HIS castle after you save him was lost on me for an entire week. Also the King turing out to be Murdaw was stupid. 5 will always be the best one in my opinion. Gameplay was fun. I loved Sancho and Parry is my favorite Twin.
I love the whole dragon quest series on every video game system

An absolutely cracking game, and a great port. Easily would be 5 stars, but for some reason you can't turn the sound all the way down. If I want to grind whilst listening to music or an audiobook. Then no luck, as the sound options only go down to 1 and not 0. If that gets fixed then easily 5 stars.
Great game. The mobile controls worked surprisingly very well. Worth the price compared to playing on an emulator imho
Amazing!
One of the best classic JRPG. Love the renewed graphics. One star for forcing the unbearable English localization even when the phone is set to Japanese.
The game is as amazing as the original one. The only thing that stops me from giving it a 5 stars is that in certain areas the controls become your enemy
Good game but please make a it playable on landscape mode

I LOVE this series. However you get one star for deleting my save and not updating my cloud save. I haven't played for about a month and I load up the game and my save is gone. Not a problem except my cloud save in which I was 29 hours into the game was reset to 9 hours into the game. So I will not be purchasing anymore Square Enix android ports of games. I'll just use emulators. Kthanxbyeeeee.
Love DQ5
PLEEAAASEEEE add an in-game volume mute option. I usually play to relax before bed but the sound is killing me. $15 to get tortured by 8-bit music smdh
One of the best

Absolute Classic
Best game since zelda
This is arguably the best game in the series. A must buy for anyone that likes RPGs.

While IV was great, this game has huge amounts of technical improvement. Between new things, such as boomerangs and whips, and some cutscenes, as well as the game having a bit more in terms of strategy, besides just level grinding until you can beat the next boss. The story isn't bad, and it is a little shorter than the later games, and even IV, due to it having 6 chapters, but it's still great and (technically speaking) a huge improvement over IV. It's a great addition to the Zenithian trilogy.
Loved it
Wonderful game, but I would love it if it had actual control settings, because it's impossible to listen to music while playing, as there is always game-sound in the background.

I've played Dragon Warrior 1-4 on Nintendo many times. I finally started trying the Android versions and picked up #5 to finally see what happens after the first 4. I'm just about finished with this game and it has been a great play. The storyline is fantastic and the gameplay is easy, maybe too easy. No grinding necessary. I look forward to #6!
Fantastic!! It would be nice to be able to control the volume of the game music in settings. Otherwise it's perfect.
Game is too glitchy for older mobile devices who use Android 5.0 or lower.
Amazing game with a great story line. I have around 50+ hours spent in the game and it was definitely worth it
A masterpiece in jrpg design, and a must play for any fan of the genre.

Dragon Quest V is phenomenal. You start as a young boy in awe of your father's fighting prowess, searching for the legendary hero. By the end you'll have become a grown man with a wife and children of your own. It's a story about family, legacy and the inevitable passage of time, a journey that spans generations. Portrait mode is perfect for one-handed play. Some character accents were grating (sorry, Bianca); recruiting monsters is random. But the gameplay is pure JRPG goodness. So worth it.

This game is incredible. I played 1-4 mobile in order before this, and this blows all the rest out of the water. Few games have gotten me so invested in the story and characters like this one have. At each turn I was charmed by the people in the party and excited to see where the story took them next. This is a masterpiece. If you like JRPGs, this is definitely worth the money.
Lost over 40 hours cloud save doesn't work.
A fun RPG that tells a story of a young boy who grows into a fine man in spite of adversity. It also has a monster collection mechanic.
No Landscape mode? This is ridiculous!
I'm a absolute nerd!!! For this game!!! I still have DQ6 on my DS I loved that game and now I get this one yes!!!!!!

This is my first Dragon Quest game and wow, it is addicting and I'm loving the story. I was skeptic having my first experience be on a mobile phone but from what I've played, it runs incredibly smooth on my Pixel 2. Not only that but I think the DS version looks more appealing than the PS2 copy of this game. This game is incredible. Im not finished but I now see what the hype over Dragon Quest is about and this is coming from tons of JRPGs beforehand. Can't wait to try the rest of the series!

Major security issue with this app. The most recent version of the app now requires *full access* to your Google Drive account in order to backup your saves. The previous version correctly requested to manage its own data only. This means the app and SE can access every file on your Drive. SE has indicated this is "working as intended" and they will not fix it. Do not buy this app.
I want refund

Dragon Quest 5 is one of the finest JRPG's ever created and if you're looking to play this classic for the first time this is a great purchase. But... If you are like me and bought this version to have something to play during a long flight, you're going to be extremely disappointed. For some reason this single player game, with no online features, requires an internet connection.

Game was working great but the newest update to accomodate iPhones broke the UI for me, which is infuriating. The camera control bar is now midscreen for whatever reason instead of the very bottom. I'm on Galaxy S9+. Hopefully they come with another update to fix this soon, otherwise this review is staying at 3 stars.

The best Mobile game you can buy. Very short 15 hour game at most. Worth the money for the content and story. REQUIRES YOU KNOW HOW TO READ which 95% OF PEOPLE DON'T KNOW HOW TO. If you read through the story and can think then you can appreciate this legendary game. If you lack imagination and are racist with a closed off mind and a boring personality you probably won't link this game.

Absolute masterpiece, the story is all that a Dragon Quest game is about, family, and of course, the fight against evil. This game is a remastered version of the DS, so basically everything that the DS version had is here, but with better graphics and some minor changes in menus and stuff. The gameplay is the basic DQ gameplay we all know about, the turn based RPG with random encounters, get to a fight, choose your actions carefully, and don't die. A must for any DQ fan to play.
10/10 Experience well other than the gamepad being a bit janky it's a really good game.

So it is basically black screen, world, black screen, black screen, world, and any other variant of that switching/glitching back and forth. I can't continue on if I can't see.

This was the first DQ game that I've only experienced on the Android 
platform. I was not disappointed! This game has a good storyline, and the 
world is vast. It has some great replay value due to a few key features: 
marriages and monster recruitment. I'd played and beaten 1-4 in the past, 
and this is a great addition to the DQ family.

Playing this game for the first time, I am at 20 hours, and absolutely loving it. Though somewhat antiquated, the battle system along with the constant equipment upgrades, Monster hunting, and plentiful side quests and mini-games make this absolutely a joy to play. Worth every penny.
This game never gets old. A beautiful story that can be replayed over and over again. I wish SquareEnix made new games like this. 5 stars hands down.

Square Enix always manages to improve every successor to Dragon Quest. DQ V is much more playable and fun than its predecessors.  The story is rich and enchanting.  Highly recommend you join and complete your quest as the legendary hero.

Absolute stunning storyline! Variation of dialogues between each and every characters really adds up to the immersion as well! Playing this game makes you feel as if you're being indulged in the world of Dragon Quest yourself!

Since it's no different than the DS version overall, I don't have any issues gamplay-wise.  My only concern is immersion-wise, I feel losing something in the Android version since the character portraits or images only shown in battles.  Even it's too small in battles. The character status and face portraits should've taken half the screen since the game is played in portrait orientation, so we get the same proportions like the DS version.  Unlike the DS version, the attributes menu in the game shows character sprites rather than portraits. I feel this is pointless since we see the sprites all the time while playing. Meanwhile, the portraits only seen in battle (did I mention it's too small?), making Toriyama's art that we should feel present in a DQ game kinda absent. It's a loss for a DQ game.  I hope the developer still wants to just give an update so portraits will be seen in attributes menu too, just like the DS version.
Needs a update every other day. Then when I do the update it wipes out my saved file.

The game itself is exceptional. Classic jRPG gameplay, a deep monster-catching system and the best story in the series, at least to me. But I have to take off two stars for the glitch that kept cloud save from working for two and a half months. It's fine now, but who knows when another bug will come along? And if you look at FF7, you'll see that sometimes Squeenix Android bugs just never get fixed. Buy at your own risk!

This is the first time I've been able to complete a Dragon Quest game. I tried the DS versions of IV and V, but they never "clicked"with me. This is an enhanced port of the DS version, and it keeps that portrait orientation, but removes the DS hinge-bar. The battle animations are top-notch, the cloud saves are great, if you have a phone and a tablet that you want to switch between, and the click-anywhere controls make it really easy to navigate without getting in your own way. This really is a great port.
Would give this 15 dollar title 5 stars if it had controler support, please add it yo..
Love this game and i have for years.
If only i could battle you all! I would win!

By the end of this game I felt like I went through a life time in this game. The immersive story, extensive gameplay and quirky characters were so engaging that complementing it has left me somewhat empty. I have no experience with the handheld version but the mobile phone port was done really well from a blind perspective. I'm definitely looking forward to trying other games in this series. I have quite a bit of catching up to do.

This is the best game that I played so far because of the good story line of the game, I love Bianca she is like a dream girl, some points in the game gave me a tear in my eyes when I got my Bianca back.

Dragon Quest, the series that separates the children from the real Adventurers. In a day before save everywhere and chronic restarting of levels came to be the norm we had Dragon Quest and Dragon Warrior! I laugh at all the children crying because they can't save everywhere. Welcome to the days games challenged gamers.

It has been my favourite since 20 years ago. I played this game when it was released in SFC, but never finish. 10 years later, I got a chance to play the remake version in PS2, yet again I did not finish it as I was so busy getting myself in a college. Cant believe this time... it goes with me everywhere (even on plane), allowing me to finish off what I started and clear up everything unresolved in the past. This brings back lots of my childhood memory. Good job Square Enix.Thanks for making the great game.
The controls suck at first, but can get used to them.  I'd really like to see a version for android TV, like the final fantasy apps.   Needs controller support.

Don't let the prices scare you, because you get LOTS of playtime out of the Dragon Quest titles, and replayability.  My only complaint is trying to find time to play an array of Dragon Quest and Final Fantasy titles!

First let me say this is my first dragon quest rpg to date and while I have yet to finish It, I feel bad for missing out all these years.  Admittedly the controls are a little shaky, especially at first, as it can be a little difficult making a precise turn into a stairway sometimes.  However the benefits of having a clean interface that obscures so little of what is even in this age a very beautifully designed and animated game far outweigh the occasional directional hiccup.  Definitely a must buy!

Dragon Quest V is about as pure as JRPGs come. You follow the adventures of a young boy as he grows into an adult. Battles are turn based and challenging. They feel a little unfair sometimes, but never unbeatable. There is a lot of grinding. Expect to fight many battles to earn the levels and money needed to face the challenges at hand. There is a monster capturing element that also takes time. The graphics are nice yet pixelated, and the controls are unwieldy but functional. Highly recommended!

Everything, every phone call, text, and alert that you check or answer and you lose all your progress going back to your last auto save this is absolutely game breaking. Like the FF series, I have been a big fan of DQ. I have played all the DQ, and have been a huge fan of the story of DQV and have been waiting for this to come to Android! Like DQIV, the controls will take a bit of getting used to, but the game itself is just like I remember, except for the updated dialogue and character names. I personally don't like the changes since I hold the Japanese version close to heart. Regardless, I still give it 5 stars, great game, story, fun! DS version, choose from 3 girls! =D
